score_scale.conversion: slimming_pct / 10.7 for negative; widening_pct / 15.37 for positive

principles.name: Horizontal Stripes (Helmholtz Illusion)
principles.mechanism: Visual system extends perception orthogonal to line orientation. Horizontal lines cause vertical extension (taller/thinner); vertical lines cause horizontal extension (wider). Instance of broader Oppel-Kundt illusion.
principles.core_finding: Horizontal stripes slim thin bodies (Helmholtz) but widen large bodies (Ashida reversal). Crossover at W:H ratio ~0.52.

key_sources.author: Helmholtz
key_sources.finding: Horizontal lines make figure look taller

key_sources.author: Thompson & Mikellidou
key_sources.finding: Horizontal stripes 5.8% slimmer than vertical on 2D; 10.7% on 3D mannequin

key_sources.author: Ashida et al.
key_sources.finding: Effect is body-shape dependent; significant for thin (p=0.00056) not fat figures

key_sources.author: Imai
key_sources.finding: Full reversal on overweight: vertical 15.37% thinner than horizontal (n=137, SD=9.24%)

key_sources.author: Koutsoumpis et al.
key_sources.finding: Stripe and luminance are two independent additive parameters

key_sources.author: Swami & Harris
key_sources.finding: Real-world contradiction: horizontal stripes widen (Cohen's d=0.63)

key_sources.author: Wackermann & Kastner
key_sources.finding: Oppel-Kundt non-monotonic curve: peaks at 11-13 fillers then declines

key_sources.author: Wackermann & Kastner
key_sources.finding: Paradoxical reversal when filling strokes 3x taller than delimiters (2/6 subjects)

transition_zones.effect: Effect passes through zero; unreliable direction

principles.name: Dark Colors (Luminance/Irradiation Illusion)
principles.body_type_dependent: partly — inversely scales with body width
principles.mechanism: Irradiation illusion: bright areas appear larger than identical dark areas. Non-linear visual processing of luminance (ON/OFF channel asymmetry in retinal ganglion cells). Dark contours contract inward; light contours expand outward.
principles.core_finding: Dark garments reduce perceived width by 0.2-1.5% depending on background luminance. Effect near-zero on white backgrounds, 7x stronger on dark backgrounds.

key_sources.author: Koutsoumpis et al.
key_sources.finding: Luminance independently reduces perceived width; bg multiplier ~7x

key_sources.author: Sidhu et al.
key_sources.finding: Black/red rated slimmest; grey/green rated widest. Skin tone interaction confirmed.

key_sources.author: Wackermann
key_sources.finding: Luminance contrast contributes 20-33% of Oppel-Kundt expansion

key_sources.author: Hu et al.
key_sources.finding: Crowdsourced: dark clothes slightly reduce perceived weight; H-stripes no effect vs solid

hue_rankings_perceived_slimness.anomaly: wider than white despite lower L*

principles.name: Color Temperature (Warm/Cool Advancing/Receding)
principles.mechanism: Warm colors advance, cool colors recede — but this is a DEPTH effect, not a SIZE effect. Optical chromatic aberration and magno/parvocellular interactions affect perceived depth ordering, not perceived width.
principles.core_finding: Width score contribution: 0.00. The red 'slimming' anomaly (Sidhu 2021) is captured in luminance function's hue-correction term, not here.

key_sources.author: Itten
key_sources.finding: Warm colors advance, cool colors recede

key_sources.author: PMC11652407
key_sources.finding: Mechanism is depth ordering, not size. Red figure 55-65% viewing time vs gray ~50%

scoring_parameters.note: No width effect from temperature alone. Any color-based slimming from hue captured in luminance principle.

principles.name: Proportion Division (Golden Ratio)
principles.mechanism: A horizontal break (belt, waistline, color transition) divides the body into upper and lower segments. When upper:lower approaches golden ratio (0.382:0.618), perceived proportions are judged optimal. Deviation creates perceived imbalance.
principles.core_finding: Harmful for apple/plus-size when break is at widest point. Body-type-adjusted targets: tall=0.34, default=0.382.
principles.evidence_notes: Golden ratio as universal target is Western-centric and contested. Cross-cultural research shows preferred proportions vary. Confidence for Western: 0.65, global: 0.45.

principles.name: Visual Attention and Eye Tracking
principles.mechanism: Garment features create 'visual weight' that redirects gaze. Zones receiving more attention are perceived as larger. Attention-to-size conversion: 1% fixation shift -> 0.3-0.5% perceived size change.
principles.core_finding: Backfires when focal point is at concern zone (draws MORE attention to area user wants to minimize). Loose clothing redirects gaze from waist to legs, producing ~1 dress size underestimation.

key_sources.author: Cundall & Guo
key_sources.finding: Loose clothing shifts fixation from waist to legs; 1 dress size underestimation

key_sources.author: Sidhu et al.
key_sources.finding: Black -> upper body gaze; white -> waist-hip gaze

critical_failure_modes: Embellishment at widest point maximizes attention to widest zone
Uniform visual weight (all-over busy print) provides no redirection
Competing focal points split attention, functionally equivalent to no focal point

principles.name: Vertical Lines (Horizontal-Vertical Illusion)
principles.mechanism: Horizontal-Vertical Illusion (HVI): vertical extents are overestimated 5-10% relative to equal horizontal extents. Vertical elements in garments (seams, buttons, zippers) create perceived height increase and width decrease.
principles.core_finding: Count-dependent reversal: too many vertical lines become a pattern that fills space (Oppel-Kundt), reversing the elongation effect. Optimal at low counts (1-3 seams).

principles.name: V-Neckline (Müller-Lyer Elongation)
principles.mechanism: V-neckline creates Müller-Lyer wings-out (diverging) configuration at the neckline, producing perceived torso elongation. Effect peaks at ~30 degree fin angle from body axis.
principles.core_finding: Deep V on wide chest backfires. The Müller-Lyer illusion at optimal angle produces up to 15-18% elongation of the shaft (torso segment between neckline elements).
failure_modes: Gap between design element and body edge (8-18mm) can REVERSE the illusion
Opposite-direction wings on same axis partially cancel

principles.name: Garment Fit (Direct Effect + Multiplier)
principles.mechanism: Garment fit acts as BOTH a multiplier on L1-3 effects AND an additive direct effect at L4. Loose clothing removes diagnostic shape cues, causing size underestimation via gaze redirection. Fitted clothing on irregular contours can add perceived width.
principles.core_finding: Opposite recommendations by body type. Loose clothing on larger bodies: 1 dress size underestimation. Fitted on smooth contours: defines shape. Fitted on irregular contours: reveals every bump.

key_sources.author: Cundall & Guo
key_sources.finding: Loose clothing produces 1 dress size underestimation on larger bodies

principles.body_size_dependency: OPPOSITE recommendations: fitted for smooth/thin contours, loose for larger/irregular contours

principles.name: Neckline Effects on Body Perception
principles.mechanism: Neckline type and depth control perceived neck length, shoulder width, bust framing, and upper body volume. Each neckline creates a specific geometric interaction with the body.

key_effects.v_neck: Elongation via Muller-Lyer wings-out. Depth determines perceived extension. Dividing threshold by bust size.
key_effects.crew_neck: Shortens perceived neck by ~1.0 inch. Creates horizontal line across upper chest.
key_effects.boat_neck: Widens perceived shoulder width by 1.5-3.0 inches. Horizontal emphasis.
key_effects.square_neck: Angularizes face shape perception. Creates structured frame.
key_effects.turtleneck: Shortens perceived neck by ~2.0 inches. Creates monolithic column effect. REVERSAL for long necks.
key_effects.sweetheart: Bust illusion via curved neckline framing. Enhances perceived bust by 0.5-1.0 cup size.
key_effects.cowl_neck: Adds volume at upper chest. Drape creates visual mass.
key_effects.off_shoulder: Exposes shoulder-to-arm transition. Effect depends on shoulder width relative to body.
key_effects.wrap_surplice: COMPOUND mechanism: V-elongation + diagonal slimming + waist definition + bust accommodation

principles.name: Sleeve Effects on Arm and Shoulder Perception
principles.mechanism: Sleeve termination point determines perceived arm width. Arm appears as wide as where it's last visible. The TRANSLATION PROBLEM: same sleeve length creates different effects on different arm lengths.

key_effects.cap_sleeve: Creates 'ledge' effect at widest upper arm. Widens perceived arm by framing at maximum circumference. Score: -0.30 to -0.60.
key_effects.three_quarter: Terminates at forearm narrowest point — OPTIMAL for arm slimming. Score: +0.75 to +1.00. BUT translation problem on petite/tall arms.
key_effects.puff_sleeve: Shoulder widening by 0.5-4.0 inches depending on volume. Peak use case: pear body. Extreme reversal: inverted triangle.
key_effects.flutter: Widens at shoulder but with movement/softness that reduces harshness vs cap sleeve.

principles.key_concept: Sleeve Frame Effect: termination at widest arm point (position 3 inches from shoulder) is worst; termination at forearm narrowest (3/4 length) is optimal.
principles.translation_problem: Standard '3/4 sleeve' at 17 inches from shoulder reaches WRIST on petite arms (<21 inches) and mid-forearm on tall arms (>25 inches).

principles.name: Hemline Effects on Leg Perception
principles.mechanism: Hemline position relative to anatomical landmarks determines perceived leg length. Three DANGER ZONES exist: widest thigh, kneecap, widest calf. Safe zone between knee and calf may COLLAPSE on petite bodies.

key_effects.above_knee: Elongation benefit: +0.20 per inch above knee (diminishing returns). Max +0.60.
key_effects.knee_danger: Bisects leg at joint. Score: -0.30 to -0.40.
key_effects.below_knee_safe: Zone between knee danger and calf danger. Score: +0.15 to +0.30 if zone exists.
key_effects.calf_danger: Frames leg at maximum lower-leg width. Score: -0.35 to -0.50.
key_effects.ankle: Frames at narrowest leg point. Score: +0.25 to +0.45.
key_effects.floor: Legs fully covered. Score: +0.05 to +0.15 (tall); -0.10 (petite without heels).

principles.translation_problem: A 'knee length' dress on a 5'9 model lands at mid-thigh on a 5'2 body. Garment length must be scaled by height ratio.
principles.zone_collapse: When knee-to-calf distance < 4.5 inches (petite), danger zones OVERLAP. No safe below-knee position exists.

principles.name: Waistline and Proportion Effects
principles.mechanism: Waist placement shifts perceived division between upper and lower body, directly controlling torso-to-leg ratio. Golden ratio target: visual legs = 61.8% of total visual height.

key_effects.empire: Under bust — raises visual waist. Elongates perceived legs. BUT: tent effect risk on large bust + stiff fabric. Shape loss on hourglass.
key_effects.high_waist: Between empire and natural. Good balance of elongation and waist definition.
key_effects.natural_waist: At anatomical waist. Maintains current proportions. Belt at natural waist on apple = HARMFUL.
key_effects.drop_waist: Below natural waist. Shortens perceived legs. Severe worsening on short legs.
key_effects.no_waist: Column without division point. Neutral score.

principles.name: Silhouette and Fit Effects
principles.mechanism: Silhouette controls which body zones are revealed vs. concealed, and creates engineered shapes that may differ from body shape.

key_effects.a_line: Skims hips without clinging. Good for pear. Creates triangle that balances wider shoulders on inverted triangle.
key_effects.bodycon: Reveals all contours. Positive on smooth contours, negative on irregular contours.
key_effects.fit_and_flare: Cinches waist + flares at hip. Flare origin point is critical — must be below true hip (at high hip) for pear.
key_effects.shift: Straight column. Minimal shaping. Good for rectangle (doesn't emphasize lack of curves). Bad for hourglass (hides curves).

principles.name: Color and Pattern Effects (Construction Context)
principles.mechanism: Dark color slimming (2-5% real, not 10-15% popular belief), horizontal stripe body-size dependency, skin-tone contrast, monochrome vs. color blocking. Shape-loss paradox: black erases waist definition on hourglass.

key_effects.dark_color: Near-black slims ~4% (L*<=10); dark ~3% (L*<=25); medium-dark ~2% (L*<=40); medium ~0.5%; light: mild widening.
key_effects.hourglass_black_paradox: Monochrome dark on hourglass ERASES waist definition. Net negative for strong hourglass (waist-hip diff >= 8 inches). Score: -0.30 at pure black.
key_effects.stripe_ashida: Body-size dependent: <30th percentile width H-stripes slim (+0.20); >70th percentile H-stripes widen (-0.18). Based on hip circumference proxy.

name: Surface Sheen -> Volume Amplification
physics: Shiny surfaces create specular highlights on convex body areas. The viewer's eye interprets these highlight-to-shadow gradients as 3D volume. The steeper the body curvature, the tighter the highlight, and the larger the area appears.
critical_reversal: Dark + Shiny Inversion: Dark shiny fabric on curved zones = VOLUME ADDING despite dark color. The dark surface absorbs ambient light, BUT specular highlights on the curve apex are MORE dramatic against the dark background (higher contrast). Black MATTE on apple belly: -0.27 + (-0.10) = -0.37 (WORKS - slimming). Black SHINY on apple belly: -0.27 + (+0.42) = +0.15 (FAILS - amplifying). The surface overwhelms the color. This is the #1 most dangerous common advice failure.

name: Cling Threshold Model
physics: Fabric clings when body curvature creates enough contact pressure to overcome gravity and fabric stiffness. The threshold depends on curvature rate, fabric properties, and ease.
base_formula: base_threshold = 62 - (26 x curvature_rate) where curvature_rate = circumference_differential / vertical_distance
coefficient_confidence: LOW (<50%) - The 62 and 26 are reverse-engineered from endpoints, not measured. Cling onset is likely sigmoidal (phase transition), not linear.

name: Color Lightness -> Volume Effect
physics: Irradiation illusion - light objects appear larger than dark objects. Validated in perception research at 2-7% perceived size change.

name: Fabric Weight/Structure -> Volume Effect
physics: Structured/stiff fabric (low drape) stands away from the body, creating air gaps. Gap width -> perceived volume.
bridging_formula: bridging_capacity = (6 - drape) x 0.8 inches. Drape 2: bridges up to 3.2" projection. Drape 4: up to 1.6". Drape 5: up to 0.8". Drape 6+: cannot bridge.

name: Texture/Pattern Effects
physics: Vertical stripes on 2D surfaces elongate (standard advice). On 3D bodies with projection > 2", stripes curve around the body, REVEALING curvature rather than masking it.
stripe_width_effect: Wide stripes (>1") on curvy bodies show curvature most dramatically

pattern_scale_vs_body_size.petite_max_safe_repeat: torso_length x 0.12. 5'0": max ~1.4" repeat. 5'3": max ~1.6" repeat.
pattern_scale_vs_body_size.plus_size_scaling: Size 4-8: baseline. Size 16-20: x1.3-1.5. Size 22+: x1.5-1.8.

horizontal_stripes_help_cases: Pear upper body: adds width at narrow shoulders (proportion balance)
Rectangle anywhere: creates faux curves at bust/hip
Tall-lean bodies: breaks excessive height (proportion benefit)

name: Drape -> Silhouette Conformity
physics: How closely fabric follows body contours. Negative = compression/smoothing. Positive = independent shape/volume.
ponte_sweet_spot: Drape 5-6: For plus-size bodies, drape 5-6 consistently outperforms both higher and lower values. Drape 7+ conforms to body irregularities while drape 1-4 creates choppy contact-gap alternation on large curves. Quantified advantage vs structured woven: 0.30-0.46 volume difference, massive smoothness improvement (0.85 vs 0.30).

name: Silhouette Shape Effectiveness
physics: How different garment silhouettes interact with different body types.

pear.fails_when: Fluid fabric (collapses to body-con at hip), stiff fabric (projects wider than hip)

apple.fails_when: Natural waist A-line (starts at widest point = amplifies)

rectangle.works_when: Universal - creates shape that doesn't exist

inverted_triangle.works_when: Strong - adds hip width for balance

wrap_dress_gapping: gap_threshold = (fabric_stretch_pct x 0.15) + wrap_overlap_inches. Belly projection > gap_threshold -> wrap physically opens at belly. SOLUTION: Faux-wrap construction.

peplum_effects.helps: Apple (bridges over belly), Rectangle (creates shape), Inverted Triangle (adds hip width for balance)

name: Construction Features
physics: Darts, seams, sleeves, and necklines create structural effects on perceived body shape.

darts_on_hourglass.differential: 0.30 to 0.45 - one of the LARGEST effects in entire model

sleeve_type_critical_cases.cap_sleeve: Universally flattering IF arm circ <13". Above 15": AVOID. Hits at widest arm point = 'sausage sleeve' effect.
sleeve_type_critical_cases.three_quarter_sleeve: Universally flattering for ALL body types and arm sizes. Ends at narrowest forearm point.
sleeve_type_critical_cases.raglan: Reduces shoulder emphasis (good for inverted triangle).
sleeve_type_critical_cases.dolman: Covers full arms (good for plus-size), but overwhelms petite.

neckline_by_body_type.v_neck: Best for petite (elongates), inv. triangle (narrows shoulders), apple (draws eye up). Caution on full bust (draws attention).
neckline_by_body_type.boat_neck: BEST for pear (widens shoulders), WORST for inverted triangle.
neckline_by_body_type.crew_high_neck: Problematic on full bust (stretches across = strain lines).

name: Hemline Effects
physics: Where the hem hits determines what body width gets visual emphasis. The hem is a horizontal 'stop' line.
pear_dead_zone: 3" range centered on widest hip point, approximately 7-10 inches below natural waist. Any hemline here: +0.10-0.18 (draws eye to widest point).

name: Photo-to-Reality Discount
physics: Product photos are shot on size 0-4 models at 5'9"-5'11" with low projection everywhere. Fabric NEVER clings on the model even in fitted garments.

photo_gap_per_inch_coefficients.belly_projection: +0.06 per inch beyond model's 0.5" (HIGHEST per-inch contributor. At 6" projection: +0.33 extreme)

photo_accuracy_spectrum: Tall rectangle (85%) -> Tall lean -> Rectangle -> Inverted triangle -> Petite lean -> Hourglass -> Pear -> Apple -> Plus-hourglass -> Plus-apple (47% - MOST MISLEADING)

manipulation_discount.base_components: pinning +0.08, steaming +0.04, lighting +0.03, posing +0.05, retouching +0.04 = 0.24 total

manipulation_confidence: LOW (<50%) - individual manipulation values are fabricated, total range reasonable but breakdown is a guess

name: Horizontal Stripe Thinning (Helmholtz Illusion)
research: Thompson & Mikellidou (2011): H vs V on rectangles 10.7% thinner, on 3D mannequins 5.8%. Koutsoumpis et al. (2021): H vs solid small but significant thinning, luminance interaction. Ashida et al. (2013): effect stronger for thin figures, weakens/reverses for fat figures.
engine_calibration: Base H-vs-solid: +0.03. Body-size gate: plus-size -0.08 (Ashida nullification). Zone-split for pear and INVT. Fine stripes (<1cm) +0.03 bonus. Dark H stripes +0.04 luminance bonus (Koutsoumpis).

name: Dark/Black Slimming (Irradiation Illusion)
research: Toscani et al. (2020): n=1000 confirming body-width slimming from dark clothing, body-size independent. Helmholtz (1867): original irradiation effect.
critical_interaction_dark_sheen: Dark + matte = maximum slimming (+0.20 for apple). Dark + high sheen (SI > 0.5) = specular highlights on dark surround creates MAXIMUM contour visibility (-0.15 penalty). Net effect depends on fabric.
skin_tone_interaction: Warm undertone: gradual sallow function. Pure black (L=0.08) on warm skin near face = skin_mult 0.36. Dark brown (L=0.18) = skin_mult 0.82. Recommend dark brown or burgundy instead of pure black for warm-toned users.

name: Rise Elongation
research: Fan, Yu & Hunter (2004): perceived leg length increases ~1.5cm per cm of rise above mid-rise (20cm reference). Maximum benefit ~7.6cm perceived elongation at ultra-high rise.
engine_formula: base = rise_delta * 0.015 per cm above 20cm mid-rise

critical_gates.petite_short_torso_inversion: torso_score <= -1.0 AND rise > 26cm: INVERTED to -0.30. High rise compresses already-short torso.
critical_gates.muffin_top_gate: Apple/Plus + belly_zone > 0.3: wide elastic (>=5cm, >=8%) = +0.10; narrow rigid (<3cm, <5%) = OVERRIDE to -0.25 (muffin top)

name: A-Line Balance
research: ASTM D5585-11 ease allowance framework. Gestalt principle of good continuation. Practitioner consensus 50+ years.

drape_gate.DC_lt_40_drapey: x1.0 full benefit, fabric follows body then flares
drape_gate.DC_gt_65_stiff: INVERTED to shelf effect. Fabric stands away from body at hip, adding net width. For plus-size, shelf effect amplified x1.5.

name: Tent/Loose Concealment (Concealment Paradox)
research: Cornelissen et al. (2009): eye-tracking study. Viewers use garment silhouette boundaries, not body contours, for size judgments under loose clothing.
semi_fitted_optimal: ER 0.03-0.08 = +0.15 (best of both worlds). Plus + structured = +0.20.

name: Color Break at Waist
research: Contrasting belt or color change at waist creates horizontal visual interruption that shortens perceived leg length by 3-5%.
hourglass_reversal: +0.20 (highlights narrow waist = best feature). Wide belt (>=5cm) = +0.25.

name: Bodycon Contour Mapping
research: Widest scoring range in entire engine (0.70 points, from hourglass +0.35 to apple -0.40). Purely body-type-dependent.

fabric_construction_gate.thin_bodycon: GSM < 200 + not structured: full contour mapping path
fabric_construction_gate.structured_bodycon: GSM >= 250 or structured: all penalties reduced ~70%

plus_size: -0.40 thin jersey vs -0.05 structured scuba. 0.35-point difference from single attribute.

name: Matte Zone Benefit
research: No direct research on fabric sheen and perceived body width. Built on optical physics reasoning. Scoring magnitudes are estimates.
cling_trap: Matte + cling_risk > 0.6: OVERRIDE to negative. Plus = -0.15, Apple = -0.12, Pear = -0.10. Conventional advice 'choose matte fabrics' backfires when fabric weight and drape ignored.

name: V-Neck Elongation
research: V-necklines create vertical visual channel elongating torso and slimming frame.

scores.petite_short_torso_high_rise: -0.05 (CONFLICT: V pulls DOWN, high waist pulls UP)

cross_garment_conflict: V-neck + high rise on petite short torso = -0.05 (conflicting attention directions framing shortest segment)

name: Monochrome Column
research: Single-color outfit creates unbroken vertical line elongating perceived height 3-5%.

name: P1: Shoe Height (Physical Elevation)
mechanism: Physical height gain from heels and platforms. The only principle where effect is a direct measurement rather than perceptual estimate. 3" stiletto adds 3.0" actual height; conversion to perceived height ~90% for slim heels, ~65% for chunky platforms (visual bulk penalized in S13).
scoring_function: heel <= 0.5: 0.0. heel <= 2.0: effective = heel. heel 2-4: effective = 2.0 + (heel-2.0)*0.80. heel 4+: effective = 2.0 + 2.0*0.80 + (heel-4.0)*0.60. score = min(0.80, effective/2.25).
body_type_modifiers: None — physical height gain is universal. Petite amplifier does NOT apply.
exceptions: None for positive gain. Visual penalty for chunky platforms handled in S13. Net effect = P1 score + S13 penalty. Example: 3" chunky platform P1=+0.59, S13=-0.12, net=+0.47. 3" stiletto P1=+0.59, S13=0.00, net=+0.59.
research_gaps: Diminishing returns curve (60% above 4") estimated from posture observation, not measured.

name: P2: Monochromatic Column
mechanism: Two additive effects from head-to-toe tonal unity: (1) Continuity elongation — unbroken vertical color surface prevents segmentation (Lee 2020: ~1" taller). (2) Dark recession — dark colors recede, reducing perceived width -> increased perceived height (Beck 2013).
scoring_function: column_de = max_de*0.60 + avg_de*0.40 (worst gap weighted 60%). column_score = 0.40 / (1 + exp(0.20*(column_de-8))). DE=0->0.40, DE=5->0.28, DE=10->0.15, DE=20->0.03. Luminance mod: avg_L<30 x1.15 (dark), avg_L>70 x0.75 (bright reduced). Skin-ext bonus: shoe_skin_de<5 +0.08, <10 +0.04. Max 0.50.
exceptions: P1-A: Bright monochrome on plus ATTENUATION/INVERSION (L*>70 or chroma>40, column bonus x0.30 bright warm / x0.50 bright cool)
P1-B: Texture mismatch breaks column ATTENUATION (satin top + matte bottom, reduced to 40-90%)
P1-C: Metamerism under different lighting (DE may shift 5-15 under tungsten, cannot detect)
P1-D: Extremely petite + oversized volume ATTENUATION (height<58" + relaxed fit, score x0.60-0.75)
research_gaps: +0.5-1.5" range from Lee (2020) studying suits. Real-world magnitude unmeasured. Bright-vs-dark distinction extrapolated from Koutsoumpis (2021).

name: P3: Waist Elevation (Proportion Manipulation)
mechanism: Moving perceived waist above natural waist transfers visual length from torso to legs. Longer legs -> taller appearance (Li 2016: optimal at golden ratio ~38% torso / 62% legs). Each inch of elevation adds ~0.30-0.50 perceived inches. MOST BODY-CONDITIONAL PRINCIPLE.
scoring_function: elevation = garment_rise - 10.5 (natural rise). Tuck visibility: full_tuck=1.00, half_tuck=0.70, untucked=0.15, belt>=0.85, dress>=0.90. Ratio-dependent per_inch: ratio>1.15: min(0.22, 0.15+(ratio-1.15)*0.30). ratio>1.00: 0.10+(ratio-1.00)*0.33. ratio>0.90: 0.06. ratio>0.85: 0.02. ratio<0.85: max(-0.20, -0.08-(0.85-ratio)*0.50) = INVERSION. score = max(-0.35, min(0.50, elevation*per_inch*tuck_visibility)).

body_type_modifiers.apple: 0.70 (drops to 0.45 with DD+ bust + short torso)

exceptions: P3-A: High-waist on short torso INVERSION (ratio<0.85: -0.15 to -0.30"; ratio<0.78: -0.25 to -0.55". Bust C+ amplifies compression x1.3)
P3-B: Untucked top wastes high-waist NULLIFICATION (full tuck 100%, half 50-70%, untucked waistband hidden 0-5%)
P3-C: Stiff/thick waistband creates visual bulk ATTENUATION (thin<1" 100%, medium 1-2" 85-95%, thick 2-3" 65-80%, paperbag>3" 40-60%)
research_gaps: CRITICAL: Per-inch conversion (0.30-0.50") needs parametric testing. Inversion threshold (ratio 0.85) is biggest calibration risk — could be 0.75 or 0.90.

name: P4: V-Neckline
mechanism: V creates triangular negative space tracing vertical path from chin to V-point. Per Kunnapas (1955), vertical lines overestimated by ~5-7%. V depth determines length of implicit vertical line; angle determines how vertical (narrow=more) vs horizontal (wide=scoop) it reads.
scoring_function: depth_score = 0.18 * (1 - exp(-0.30*depth)). Depth: 2"->+0.04, 4"->+0.10, 6"->+0.15, 8+"->+0.18. angle_mod = max(0.25, 1.0 - max(0,angle-45)*0.01). Narrow 30-45=1.00, medium 60-80=0.85, wide>120=0.25. Ratio gate: ratio>1.15 AND depth>5: -0.50 INVERSION. ratio>1.10: 0.50. ratio>1.00: 0.80. else: 1.00. score = max(-0.15, min(0.20, depth*angle*ratio)).
exceptions: P2-A: V-neck exaggerates long torso INVERSION (ratio>1.15, depth>5": V subtracts -0.05 to -0.20". Rescue: deep V + high-waist tuck = +0.05 to +0.15")
Inverted triangle wide V (>60 deg) draws eye to widest zone, modifier 0.25-0.65
Apple + large bust (DD+, depth>6") draws eye to bust width, modifier 0.60
research_gaps: Kunnapas (1955) solid on vertical line overestimation. Application from abstract lines to V-shaped negative space on clothed body is significant extrapolation.

name: P5: Slim Fit Benefit
mechanism: Beck (2013) confirmed width-height inverse: reducing perceived body width by ~10% increases perceived height by ~1-2%. At 62": ~0.6-1.2" raw, attenuated 50% for clothing context -> 0.3-0.6" net.
scoring_function: fit_scores: bodycon=0.18, slim=0.14, regular=0.08, relaxed=0.02, oversized=0.00. Too-tight detection: bodycon + hip-waist diff>10 + bottom zone -> -0.08 INVERSION. bodycon + bust>40 + DD+ + top zone -> -0.05. Zone-specific body-type: pear top x1.30 / bottom x0.60. apple top x0.40 / bottom x1.20. INVT top x0.50 / bottom x1.30. score = max(-0.15, min(0.20, base)).
exceptions: P5-A: Too-tight creates horizontal pull lines INVERSION (fitted no pull +0.10-0.20", tight 1-2 lines 0.00-0.10", too-tight 3+ lines -0.05 to -0.20")
P5-B: Column dress on curvy figures ATTENUATION (waist-hip diff>10": gap at waist or tension at widest)

name: P6: Nude / Skin-Matched Shoes
mechanism: When shoe color matches skin tone (DE<5), visual system processes foot + leg as one continuous unit. ~25-35% of foot length (3-4") contributes to perceived leg length. Net: +0.75-1.40" raw. CRITICAL: Standard 'nude' shoes (L*70-80) only match light skin.
scoring_function: de<3: base=0.20 (perfect match). de<5: 0.15. de<8: 0.07. de<12: 0.02. de<20: -0.03. de>=20: -0.08 (high contrast ankle break). Leg coverage gate: bare=1.0, sheer_hose=0.85, opaque_tights=0.15, pants=0.0. Pants path: shoe-pant DE<5 -> 0.15. score = max(-0.10, min(0.22, base*visibility)).
exceptions: P6-A: 'Nude' doesn't match non-light skin tones NULLIFICATION/INVERSION (shoe DE>15 on dark skin: -0.05 to -0.10" penalty). Kridha signature: recommend specific shoe colors matching USER's skin tone. Skin L*=35: espresso/chocolate (L*=40-50). Skin L*=55: caramel/toffee (L*=55-65).
research_gaps: Principle sound. Gap risk in IMPLEMENTATION: accurate skin tone measurement sensitive to lighting, camera, makeup. Product 'nude' shoes vary widely.

name: P7: Proportion Rule (Golden Ratio)
mechanism: Li (2016): perceived height maximized when visible waist at golden ratio (~38% torso / 62% legs). Scores the OUTCOME — actual visible torso-to-leg ratio — rather than input (P3 scores waist elevation action). Both P3 and P7 needed because hem length, shoe height, belt position all contribute.
scoring_function: Calculate visible ratio after garment effects. leg_fraction = visible_legs / (visible_torso + visible_legs). OPTIMAL = 0.618. deviation = abs(leg_fraction - 0.618). dev<0.02: 0.30 (within 2% of golden). dev<0.05: 0.30-(dev-0.02)*4.0. dev<0.10: 0.18-(dev-0.05)*2.0. dev<0.15: 0.08-(dev-0.10)*1.0. dev>=0.15: max(-0.10, 0.03-(dev-0.15)*0.80). score = max(-0.15, min(0.30, score)).
body_type_modifiers: Minimal — function inherently adapts to body type through visible ratio calculation. Golden ratio target is universal.
exceptions: Over-elongated legs on inverted triangle: leg_fraction > 0.65 -> penalty amplified x1.3 (worsens shoulder-hip imbalance)
research_gaps: Strong convergent evidence from Li (2016), Sorokowski & Pawlowski (2008), Swami et al. (2006).

name: P8: Vertical Stripes
mechanism: THE LOWEST CONFIDENCE PRINCIPLE (35%). THE GREAT STRIPES WAR IS UNRESOLVED. Popular wisdom (since 1813): V stripes elongate. Thompson & Mikellidou (2011): OPPOSITE — H stripes thin (Helmholtz). Swami & Harris (2012): In ecological conditions, H stripes DID make person wider. Ashida (2013): Depends on body size. Koutsoumpis (2021): Separated stripes from luminance. Resolution: Both right in different contexts.
scoring_function: width<0.25: width_score=0.10. width<1.0: 0.10-(width-0.25)*0.05. width<2.5: 0.06-(width-1.0)*0.03. width>=2.5: -0.02 (wide stripes widen). Body mod: plus=-0.30 REVERSAL, curvy=0.40, slim/very_slim=1.00, average=0.70. Zone: pear bottom x0.30, INVT top x0.50. Rectangle bonus: max(body_mod, 1.20). score = max(-0.08, min(0.12, width_score*body_mod)).
exceptions: P2-B: Vertical stripes WIDEN on plus bodies INVERSION (Ashida 2013: stripes curve at hip/bust creating implicit horizontal signals)
P2-D: Wide spacing creates width INVERSION (Oppel-Kundt: spacing>2.5" = net widening)
critical_note: Never let stripe scoring drive a recommendation. Use as tiebreaker only. Never say 'vertical stripes will make you look taller.'

name: P9: Vertical Seams / Structural Lines
mechanism: More reliable than stripes: lower contrast (less susceptible to Helmholtz reversal), physically straight regardless of body curves (structural not printed), and subtle (doesn't dominate perception).
scoring_function: n = num_vertical_seams. base = min(0.18, 0.05*min(n,2) + 0.03*max(0,min(n,4)-2) + 0.01*max(0,n-4)). Princess seam bust exception: DD+ x0.55, C/D x0.85. Plus: x0.65. score = min(0.15, base).
exceptions: P2-C: Princess seams on DD+ bust ATTENUATION (princess seams curve outward at full bust, creating horizontal signals. A/B cup full benefit, C/D 80-90%, DD+ 50-70% minus ~0.05")

name: P10: Print Scale (Small-Scale Bonus)
mechanism: Visual system uses motif repetitions as implicit 'measurement units.' More repetitions = taller estimate (counting heuristic from magnitude estimation literature). Optimal motif size: 1.5-2.5% of wearer's height.
scoring_function: optimal_low = height_inches * 0.015. optimal_high = height_inches * 0.025. In optimal range: 0.05. Below optimal: 0.03. Slightly above (<=height*0.03): 0.02. Over threshold: 0.0 (penalty in S12).
exceptions: None for bonus. Penalty for oversized prints handled in S12.

name: S1: Color Break (Horizontal Segmentation at Color Boundary)
mechanism: High-contrast color boundary between top and bottom creates horizontal 'cut' dividing body into two shorter segments. Per segmentation models, two segments summing to X estimated shorter than single segment of length X (by ~3-8% at high contrast).
scoring_function: top_bottom_de<3: 0.0. Position mod: high-waist tuck 0.50, natural waist tuck 0.70, untucked at hip 1.00. Contrast penalty: -0.35 / (1 + exp(-0.10*(de-15))). penalty = contrast * position_mod * petite_amplifier. FM#1: High-waist tuck on long torso (ratio>1.05): net positive +0.15 to +0.37. FM#2: Bottom matches skin (DE<5): penalty x0.50. Max penalty: -0.40.
compound_example: Petite + Pear: 1.30 x 1.35 = 1.76 — nearly 2x baseline penalty.
exceptions: S1-C: Gradient/ombre softens break ATTENUATION (sharp 100%, gradient 2-3" 60-70%, 4-6" 30-45%, 8+" 10-20%)
S1-D: Same pattern continues across break ATTENUATION (same print diff garments 40-55%, single garment with break 20-30%)
S1-E: Sheer layer blurs boundary ATTENUATION (penalty 35-50%)
FM#1: High-waist tuck on long torso NET POSITIVE
FM#2: Bottom matches skin tone (DE<5) penalty x0.50

name: S2: Hemline Position (Mid-Calf = Maximum Damage)
mechanism: Three components at mid-calf (worst): (1) Width exposure at widest calf point (1.3-1.8x ankle width), (2) Insufficient visible leg (<15% body height), (3) Forfeited column. Combined at mid-calf on 5'2": -0.75 to -1.50 perceived inches.
scoring_function: Derive calf landmarks: floor_to_widest_calf = leg_length*0.38, floor_to_knee = leg_length*0.55. Above knee+2: 0.0. Knee zone: -0.03. Upper calf: interpolated -0.20 to -0.08. MID-CALF DANGER ZONE: base -0.30 * calf_mod * petite_amplifier. calf_mod = max(0.7, min(1.5, 0.7 + (calf_ankle_ratio-1.3)*0.6)). Slit mitigation: 35% + min(35%, slit_height*5%). Lower calf/ankle: -0.05. Max penalty: -0.40.
exceptions: FM#3: Midi on tall + slim calves ATTENUATION (height>67 AND calf_ankle_ratio<1.4 -> penalty x0.35)
FM#4: Asymmetric hem ATTENUATION (diagonal overestimation, use higher point, penalty x0.45)
S2-D: Full/circle skirt midi ATTENUATION (straight 100%, A-line 70-80%, full 50-65%, circle 40-55%)
S2-E: High-low hem ATTENUATION (front 70% weight, back 20-30%)
FM#13: Midi + color-matched boots ATTENUATION (DE<5 -> penalty x0.20, boot+skirt as column)

name: S3: Ankle Strap
mechanism: Creates horizontal boundary separating leg from foot, blocking foot-length attribution to leg line (-0.25 to -0.50") and adding horizontal band segmentation (-0.10 to -0.30"). Combined: -0.15 to -1.25 perceived inches.
scoring_function: Visibility gate: bare=1.0, sheer_hose=0.85, opaque_tights=0.25, pants=0.08, <0.10 return 0. Contrast: sigmoid 1/(1+exp(-0.12*(strap_skin_de-15))). Width factor: min(1.0, 0.35 + strap_width*0.65). penalty = -0.25 * visibility * max(contrast, width_factor) * petite_amplifier. Max: -0.30.
exceptions: FM#5: T-strap paradox +0.08 offset (vertical element 3-4" triggers vertical overestimation)
FM#6: Strappy sandal multi-strap penalty x0.40 (3+ thin straps <0.15" register as texture)
S3-C: Platform ankle strap NET POSITIVE (platform height overwhelms strap penalty)
S3-D: Gladiator sandals ATTENUATION (vertical connecting straps offset horizontal, 30-45%)

name: S4: Waist Depression (Low-Rise / Drop-Waist)
confidence: Variable — direction Tier 2, body-type modifier Tier 4
mechanism: Each inch of waist depression below natural waist transfers ~1 inch of visual length from legs to torso. Each transferred inch costs ~0.3-0.5 perceived inches at 5'2". MOST BODY-TYPE-SENSITIVE PENALTY: modifier ranges from 0.30x (short torso) to 1.80x (long torso).
scoring_function: depression = 10.5 - garment_rise (or drop_waist_inches_below). base = -0.30 * (1 - exp(-0.35*depression)). Ratio modifier: ratio>1.15: min(1.80, 1.4+(ratio-1.15)*4.0). ratio>1.05: 1.0+(ratio-1.05)*4.0. ratio>0.95: 1.0. ratio>0.85: max(0.30, 0.70-(0.95-ratio)*2.0). ratio<=0.85: 0.30. penalty = max(-0.40, base*mod*petite_amplifier).
body_type_modifiers: Built into function via ratio-dependent modifier (0.30 to 1.80). Not in body-type matrix.
exceptions: FM#7: Low-rise on short torso penalty x0.30 (ratio<0.85: depression extends torso toward golden ratio, may be LESS damaging than high-rise compression)
FM#8: Drop-waist on very tall penalty x0.35 (5'9"+ with drop<2": ratio shift only 3 percentage points)

name: S5: Oversized Fit
mechanism: Two compounding effects: (1) Width amplification -> inverse height illusion (Bennett & Warren 2013, each 10% width -> ~1-2% height decrease, attenuated 50%). Net: -0.62 to -1.86". (2) Waist landmark elimination — without visible waist, height estimation falls back on garment silhouette ratio.
scoring_function: fit_base: relaxed=-0.05, oversized=-0.18. Petite mod: <60" 1.50, <63" 1.35, <66" 1.15, else 1.00. Fabric mod: fluid 0.70, structured 1.00, stiff 1.25. Waist rescue: belt 0.65, full_tuck 0.70, half_tuck 0.80, none 1.00. penalty = max(-0.35, fit_base*petite*fabric*rescue).
exceptions: FM#9: Strategic oversized crop penalty x0.25 (oversized crop + slim high-waist bottom: width CONTRAST causes lower zone +2-4% taller)
S5-C: Open oversized layer ATTENUATION/NULLIFICATION (closed 100%, partially open 50-65%, fully open 20-35%, long open duster 15-25% — vertical edges may give net positive)
S5-D: Oversized + vertical stripes ATTENUATION (penalty x0.55-0.65)

name: S6: Cuff / Rolled Hem
mechanism: Continuous function of cuff height x interior contrast. At 1.5" with contrasting selvedge: -0.12 score. Saturates at 3"+.
exceptions: S6-A: Cuff matching shoe color (DE<5) + gap<1" -> penalty drops to 15-25%

name: S7: Cropped Gap (Above-Ankle Exposure)
mechanism: Creates color 'stripe' between pant and shoe. Penalty depends on NUMBER of distinct color zones: 3 zones (pant != skin != shoe) full penalty, 2 zones 70%, 1 zone 30%.
exceptions: FM#10: Gap<0.75" + nude shoe (DE<3) = POSITIVE (+0.02 score). Shoe merges with skin, adding ~3-4" of visual leg.

name: S8: Belt Segmentation
mechanism: Belt as horizontal band, scored by width x contrast x position. CRITICAL: Thin tonal belt at high-waist position can be NET POSITIVE (proportion benefit exceeds segmentation cost).
exceptions: FM#11: Width<0.75" AND DE<3 AND above natural waist -> penalty ~-0.005 (effectively zero). Combined with Layer 2 proportion benefit: net +0.27 to +0.54".

name: S9: Horizontal Details
mechanism: Each horizontal detail (pocket flap, yoke seam, graphic band) scored by body position. Hip zone: -0.08 per detail. Waist: -0.04. Knee: -0.05. Shoulder: -0.01. Caps at -0.20 total.

name: S10: Shoe Vamp
mechanism: High-coverage shoes interrupt leg line when leg is bare. Loafer/Mary Jane/ankle boot: -0.10 to -0.16 base.
exceptions: FM#12: Color-matched boot + opaque tights (DE<5) -> penalty x0.15. Boot EXTENDS monochromatic column instead of interrupting it.

name: S11: Fabric Bunching
mechanism: Pant fabric pooling at ankle. Slight (one fold): -0.03. Moderate (2-3 folds): -0.08. Heavy (mushrooming): -0.15.

name: S12: Print Scale Penalty
mechanism: Oversized prints (motif > 3% of height in inches). At 5'0": max comfortable motif ~1.8". Penalty scales with excess ratio, caps at -0.18.

name: S13: Shoe Bulk (Visual)
mechanism: Visual penalty for chunky/platform soles. Separate from physical height gain (P1). At 1.5" visible sole: -0.08. At 3.0": -0.18. Color contrast between sole and upper amplifies horizontal band.

name: dark_luminance
description: Irradiation illusion: dark surfaces appear smaller. 0.51% per L* step; 5-10% full range.
confidence_notes: Confidence 0.85. Koutsoumpis 2021 Exp 2. Multiple controlled experiments with effect sizes.

name: horizontal_stripes
description: Helmholtz illusion: fills extent perpendicular to lines. 0.38-0.57% vs. neutral; reverses at high WHR. Highest-stakes gate in the engine.
confidence_notes: Confidence 0.85 for base effect. Koutsoumpis 2021; Ashida 2013. Body-size moderation proven.

name: vertical_stripes
description: Oppel-Kundt: V-stripes WIDEN vs. neutral (not slim). 4.5-10.7% wider than H-striped. Popular advice that V-stripes slim is WRONG.
confidence_notes: Confidence 0.55. Thompson 2011 Exp 3-4. V-stripes only 'slim' relative to H-stripes, not relative to neutral.

name: rise_height
description: Geometric: shifts visual leg-torso ratio. +2.8pp leg proportion per 1.5 inch rise.
confidence_notes: Confidence 0.40. Geometric (exact); perception (assumed). No direct perception study on rise height.

name: v_neckline
description: Creates vertical corridor; draws eye upward. Est. +3-5% perceived height.
confidence_notes: Confidence 0.35. Practitioner consensus; no lab study.

name: monochrome
description: Oppel-Kundt: unbroken column overestimates extent. Est. +5-7% perceived height.
confidence_notes: Confidence 0.65. O-K theory + practitioner consensus.

name: a_line
description: Volume conceals hip width; flare adds visual mass. Variable by angle; shortens above 25 degrees.
confidence_notes: Confidence 0.40. Geometric + practitioner.

name: belt
description: Defines waist (slim+) but segments torso (tall-). Variable by width x contrast.
confidence_notes: Confidence 0.30. Practitioner consensus only.

name: dark_side_panels
description: Irradiation applied to garment zones. Est. 5-12% waist contraction.
confidence_notes: Confidence 0.35. Irradiation extrapolation. No direct study.

name: bodycon
description: Tight fabric traces body contour. Body-conditional: +4% to -8%.
confidence_notes: Confidence 0.50. Mechanism undisputed; scores estimated.

name: turtleneck
description: Closes neckline; conceals neck length. Variable by neck length.
confidence_notes: Confidence 0.30. Practitioner consensus only.

name: color_scorer
description: Covers C1 (dark slimming, delta_width -4% to -5%), C2 (light widening, delta_width +4% to +6%), C3 (monochrome elongation, delta_VR -0.03), and C4 (red saturation, delta_width -2% to -3%). Luminance -> base delta -> sheen modifier (EX-01) -> fit modifier (EX-02) -> structure modifier (EX-03) -> zone-specific body-type logic -> opacity scaling -> red saturation special case -> skin contrast modifier.
self_assessed_confidence: HIGH for direction, LOW for magnitude in garment context
confidence_notes: C1: Koutsoumpis 2021 d=0.61 (4-5% PSE shift). Robust in lab. Sheen > 0.7 reverses (EX-01). C2: Same mechanism in reverse. C3: Amplified on petite, pear, rectangle, plus (-0.04). Reduced on tall (-0.02). C4: Low confidence. Weight 0.08 in composite.

name: pattern_scorer
description: Covers P1 (Horizontal stripes BMI-conditional Helmholtz: BMI<22 full slimming -5%, BMI 22-28 linear decay, BMI 28-32 neutral, BMI>32 reversal +2%), P2 (Vertical stripes DO NOT SLIM: delta=0% neutral, never slimming), P3 (Diagonal lines 30-60 degrees optimal). 4-gate pipeline: count>=3 (EX-09) -> contrast>1.5 (EX-14) -> width modifier (EX-10) -> BMI-conditional Helmholtz.
self_assessed_confidence: HIGH for base Helmholtz, LOW for BMI transition points
confidence_notes: P1: Thompson 2011 + Ashida 2013 + Swami 2012. BMI-conditional resolution. Gates: min 3 stripes (EX-09), contrast>1.5 (EX-14), width>2 inch weakens (EX-10), zone-localized=emphasis not Helmholtz (EX-13). P2: Thompson 2011 +7.1% widening in lab. Competitive edge: every competitor recommends vertical stripes for slimming; we won't. P3: Practitioner only.

name: neckline_scorer
description: Modifies perceived Shoulder-Hip Ratio (SHR). Base ΔSHR lookup per neckline type -> body-specific exception cascade (EX-15 through EX-22) -> deficit-proportional conversion -> aesthetic penalties -> height/torso modifiers. All ΔSHR magnitudes are estimates from practitioner synthesis, not direct measurements.
self_assessed_confidence: MEDIUM for direction, LOW for magnitude
confidence_notes: Direction confidence 2 stars. Magnitude confidence 1 star. See Part VI Gap #08. No direct measurement studies exist.

name: sleeve_scorer
description: Modifies perceived Shoulder-Hip Ratio via sleeve construction. Puff (+0.02 to +0.06), Raglan (-0.05), Dolman (-0.04), Cap (+0.02), Dropped shoulder (-0.03). Stiff fabric multiplies puff effect 1.5x. Raglan diagonal seam invisible in same color: -60% effect on plus.
self_assessed_confidence: MEDIUM for direction, LOW for magnitude
confidence_notes: Practitioner synthesis. No direct measurement studies. Cap may be below JND (just noticeable difference).

name: bottom_silhouette_scorer
description: Scores bottom garment silhouette for hip de-emphasis, balance, or waist definition. A-line, pencil, wide-leg, pleated/full skirt. Zone-specific logic for pear (hip concealment), inverted triangle (add hip volume).
confidence_notes: Geometric and practitioner reasoning. Pear: pencil skirt AVOID (maps hip contour). Wide-leg in soft fabric good. Stiff A-line tents from widest point on pear (EX-30).

name: waist_definition_scorer
description: Modifies perceived Waist-Hip Ratio via garment waist treatments. Techniques: contrast belt (delta_WHR -0.02), wrap construction (-0.05), peplum (-0.04), princess seam (-0.06), empire waist (-0.05). Diminishing returns: 1st=100%, 2nd=80%, 3rd=50%, 4th=20%. Per-technique decision tree with failure conditions (EX-37 through EX-42) -> body-type-specific amplification or reversal.
self_assessed_confidence: MEDIUM for direction, LOW for diminishing returns curve
confidence_notes: Diminishing returns (100%, 80%, 50%, 20%) are ESTIMATED (Gap #10). Belt reversal on WHR > 0.88 well-supported by practitioner consensus. Princess seam is top rec for rectangle. Empire best for apple.

name: vertical_proportion_scorer
description: Modifies perceived Vertical Ratio (leg-to-total height). Techniques: high-waist +2 inch (delta_VR -0.06), full tuck (-0.07), front/half tuck (-0.04), nude shoe (-0.02), ankle strap (+0.025 harmful), cropped jacket (-0.03). Overcorrection detection at perceived VR < 0.30 (catastrophic) and < 0.35 (warning). Petite 1.3x multiplier. STACKING WARNING: high-waist + full tuck + matching shoe = total delta_VR -0.15.
confidence_notes: VR target 0.483 from Sorokowski & Pawlowski 2008 (27-nation replication). Garment-lengthening untested (Gap #3). Overcorrection thresholds estimated. Ankle strap strong avoid for petite (EX-48).

name: stripe_direction_width
description: Horizontal stripes REDUCE perceived width by 4.5-10.7% via Helmholtz illusion (Thompson 2011). Three-stage pipeline: Stage 1 raw Helmholtz (thinning for BWR<1.05), Stage 2 Ashida body-size modulation (attenuated 1.05-1.15, reversed >1.15), Stage 3 social-context modifier (x0.65 real-world attenuation). Vertical stripes ALWAYS widen (delta=-0.45). Popular wisdom accidentally correct for wrong reason.
self_assessed_confidence: HIGH for Helmholtz base, LOW for body-type multipliers and seam vs stripe distinction
confidence_notes: Helmholtz base: 4 stars. Ashida reversal direction: 3 stars. BWR 1.15 threshold: MY interpolation. Real-world 0.65: INVENTED. Seam vs stripe distinction: UNTESTED.

name: garment_luminance_girth
description: Dark clothing reduces perceived girth by 2-5% but ONLY vs high-chroma warm colors. Black vs white NOT statistically significant (Grillot 2024). The 'black is slimming' myth overstates the effect. Accurate: LOW LUMINANCE + MATTE FINISH reduces perceived girth by 2-5% vs HIGH CHROMA WARM. Weight 0.08 in composite. Navy/charcoal/forest green often slim BETTER than pure black.
confidence_notes: Grillot 2024: black vs yellow/green -2-3%, vs white NOT sig. Sheen override: 0 stars. Dark-skin interaction: 2 stars. All-black penalty estimated.

name: neckline_geometry
description: V-neck creates 3-7% perceived neck/torso elongation. DERIVED from V-H illusion (Kunnapas 1955), NOT directly measured on humans. V-neck best single default (60-65% of body types benefit) but NOT universally optimal. Multiple failure conditions: large bust + deep V, long neck over-elongation, petite short torso, narrow shoulders, prominent decolletage, small bust empty triangle.
self_assessed_confidence: MEDIUM for direction, LOW for magnitude
confidence_notes: 2 stars geometric derivation, not direct measurement. 3-7% claim from V-H illusion application. No direct V-neck perception study on human bodies exists.

name: hemline_position
description: Most complex scoring module. Combines Golden Ratio/Rule of Thirds (Fechner 1876), Sorokowski +5% LBR (27 nations), anatomical intersection scoring (upper thigh +0.15, lower thigh -0.12, sub-knee +0.10, UPPER CALF -0.25 worst zone, ankle +0.12), and height-dependent amplification. Mid-calf penalty amplified for shorter users.
self_assessed_confidence: MEDIUM for LBR, LOW for anatomical scoring
confidence_notes: Sorokowski +5% LBR: MEDIUM. Contradicted by Yali tribe, rural Malaysia, Frederick. India: use +3% (ZERO Indian data). Upper calf = WORST zone: V-H illusion compounds.

name: waistline_position
description: High-waist shifts LBR +5% = peak attractiveness. Four critical exceptions: short torso (TLR<0.92: empire -0.18, natural waist +0.10), apple body (must be 3-4cm above widest; empire EXCELLENT +0.40), empire overshoot (+12% LBR = maternity silhouette), muffin-top risk (rigid waistband>0.70 + soft midsection>0.60 = -0.15). Lehenga override: sits at hip, bypass standard. Drop-waist useful for apple (+0.10).
confidence_notes: High-waist LBR shift well-supported. Exception thresholds estimated. Lehenga scoring is practitioner only.

name: fabric_weight_volume
description: Heavy fabric >250 GSM adds 3-7% visual width. Light <80 GSM clings and reveals. TWO full reversals: Rectangle (heavy POSITIVE +0.15, adds missing dimension), Inv Triangle (heavy on hips POSITIVE +0.20, adds width). Petite + heavy >350 GSM: -0.20. Apple midsection + heavy: -0.35. Plus + heavy >300 GSM: -0.35. Light + large bust (diff>16cm): -0.20. Starch confound: effective_gsm = gsm x (1 + starch_factor).
confidence_notes: 1 star confidence. WEAKEST MODULE IN THE ENGINE. Almost no peer-reviewed perceptual data for fabric-body interaction. Highest priority for empirical validation.

name: color_skin_harmony
description: Three-component score: undertone match (50%), luminance contrast (35%), chroma boost (15%). NEVER use ethnicity as proxy for undertone. South Asian b* ranges 8-35 (warm, neutral, AND cool). Cultural override is MULTIPLIER not replacement. Color-blocking bonuses: pear light top+dark bottom +0.15, rectangle dark center+light sides +0.12, inv tri light bottom+dark top +0.12, petite monochrome +0.20. Pattern scale: >5cm on petite = -0.15; <3cm on plus = -0.10.
confidence_notes: Undertone matching well-established. Cultural override logic estimated. Pattern scale thresholds estimated.

name: occasion_weighted_composite
description: Occasion type changes attribute weights in composite scoring. 8 attributes (fit precision, fabric structure, silhouette, color context, exposure level, trend alignment, comfort, embellishment, cultural fit) weighted differently by occasion. Red Dress Effect: Professional +0.04 net, Date night +0.20, Indian wedding guest -0.30 (risks overshadowing bride).
confidence_notes: 0 stars. ENTIRELY INVENTED. Every number in occasion weight matrix is logical assignment. Zero empirical basis. First thing to validate with user data.

name: age_adaptive_parameters
description: Menopause step function: women lose ~30% skin collagen in first 5 years post-menopause (avg onset 51). Model uses step function at 50-55. Body composition: waist_expansion = (age-30) x 0.30%/year, height_loss = (age-40) x 0.10 cm/decade, muscle_decline = -1.5%/year after 50. ABSOLUTE RULE: NEVER reference age in user output. NEVER suggest longer sleeves based on age. Exception 9A: HRT/active/genetics create 10-15 year variation. Exception 9C: sleeveless + GSM<130 + tissue_compliance<0.70: suggest heavier fabric, never longer sleeves.
confidence_notes: Collagen decline is dermatological fact. 'Add 80 GSM' is inference. Tissue compliance from body scan preferred; age is fallback (LOW confidence).

name: climate_indian_garments
description: India is NOT single-climate (Chennai 24C, Delhi 7C Jan / 42C Jun). Monsoon changes fabric behavior. Kanjivaram silk: comfort=0.20 but wedding cultural_override=0.95, final=0.80*cultural+0.20*comfort=0.80. Layering adds visual width: each 2mm layer adds ~0.4cm/side, 3 layers=2.4cm wider. Can change body classification.
